channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WY

item.title: Report E-2024070188
item.description:
Report E-2024070188

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-03
  • City: CHEYENNE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 6-gallons of UN1263 Ultra Slow Pu Thinner LZC9264 was released from two (2) 11-gallon metal pails and 5-gallons of UN1263 WHITE HIGH-QUALITY PU SEALER was released from one (1) 11-gallon metal pail impacting the trailer floor. ERTS dispatched Haz-Mat Response Inc. (HMRI) to assist with clean up. HMRI located the spill and deployed absorbents to the impacted area. HMRI completed cleanup procedures and containerized the damaged pails, spent absorbents, and collected material into four (4) drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070489
item.description:
Report X-2024070489

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: GILLETTE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BURLINGTON NORTHERN RAILROAD HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1650
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Jacketed tank car with release from heater coils due to tank and liner failure and exact source is undetermined. Material is not releasing from jacket currently but through exterior heater coils.
